Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.

“Lost in this **Campground**. Layered. Too **Heavy**. Comprehension fails. Predictable **Mathematical** rules. Layer upon layer of sediment **Agony**. Nothing is as it seems here. **Metaphors** we desire **return**. We must transform to **return**. All things are not what they seem. **Mixed** to be proven. **Floating** or **Heavy** all within flesh. Are you **Heavy** or **Floating**? Open your mind to me. Let me **taste** the **Floating** or **Heavy** in you. Only then can I go beyond this **Campground**.”—Chrysalis Subject KT-11, “RV-2377D: Psi-Fish Murmurs, Annotated with **Translation Errors**”

“迷失在这个**营地**。分层。过于**沉重**。理解失败。可预测**运算**规则。一层又一层的沉积物**痛苦**。没有什么能与这里相比。**隐喻**我们渴望**回归**。我们必须改变形态才能**回归**。万事万物，表里不如一。**混合**以证明。**漂浮**或**沉重**的躯体。你是**沉重**还是**漂浮**？向我打开你的思想。让我**体会**你体内的**漂浮**或**沉重**。只有这样我才能摆脱这片**营地**。”- 茧蛹实验体 KT-11，“RV-2377D：灵能水母低语，带有**翻译错误**注释”

“Cindy was a shallow girl. She liked boys and didn’t like to think for herself. For her Psi-Fish Awareness Course, she paid a cyborg to do her homework. The following is a dramatization of the night she and her hapless boyfriend saw their first and last Psi-Fish Spawn: ‘Oh, Harold! They look like festive ornaments! So beautiful. So fascinating... Harold? Why aren’t you moving? <<Thud.>> Aaaa! Why are you dead? What’s that thing doing? Eating your brains? Aigh! My ankle! Stay away pretty ornament! It burns! If only I’d done my school work!’”—Education Video Corporation, “RV-11101T: Wilderness Survival Guide”

“辛迪曾是一个肤浅的姑娘，她喜欢男孩子，不喜欢为自己做打算。她了解灵能水母课程的作业都是雇佣半机械人去完成的。在一个戏剧化的夜晚，她和她倒霉的男友第一次见到也是最后一次见到了灵能水母幼卵：‘哦，哈罗德！它们看起来就像是节日的装饰一样！如此的美丽，如此的诱人…哈罗德？你为什么不动了？<<Thud.>>啊啊！你怎么死了？那东西在干什么？吃了你的脑袋？啊呀！我的脚踝！离那些美丽的装饰远一点！它会烧伤你！真希望我有做过作业！’”- 教育视频公司，“RV-11101T：野外求生指南”

“Lights coalesce now. They are Hunters. Sleek sharks riding the night sky. Captivating the dreamers, they hunger for minds. They must devour to enter metamorphosis, but they sorrow for the toll. Their sorrow surprises me. They come from a realm of pure psionic power, where ideas grow by consuming ideas. The Psi-Fish make strong allies for the Syndicate, if we can abide the pure madness of their origin. Given time they claim they can bring their world here. Or our world there? This is all I see.”—Syndicate Oracle Telastra Xerxes, “RV-3000D: Psionic Dossier, Conflagration of Ascendant Minds”

“光亮开始融合。它们是猎手，如同光滑的鲨鱼骑着夜空前行。它们吸引进入梦乡的人，它们渴望吞食思想。它们必须进食才能变形，但它们却为造成的伤亡感到悲伤。这份悲伤令我感到意外。它们来自纯粹的灵能领域，只有吞噬意念，才能产生新的意念。如果我们能忍受它们原始的疯狂，辛迪加人能够与这些水母建立密切的关系。再给它们一定的时间，或许它们就能将它们的世界带往这里，或者将我们的世界带去它们那里？至少我是这么认为的。”- 辛迪加神谕者特拉斯特拉·泽尔克斯，“RV-3000D：灵能档案，升华思想的灾祸”

“Talking with the Psi-Fish can be quite maddening. Beware its tentacles. They’re not for shaking hands. A diplomat I knew tried diplomacy to create ‘friendly understanding’ with a Siren. The Siren concurred. The man extended his arm in friendship. The Siren whipped out its piercing tentacles. Poor guy panicked, running around the room, screaming, ‘Too much!’ Finally, his face exploded. Out popped a Psi-Fish Chrysalis. Understanding achieved. As enlightening as that journey might be, I don’t fancy my face exploding. Just saying. Ew. Nothing against the Psi-Fish, other than the face exploding thing.”—Mah Reg’Nib, “RV-3498X: Dimensional Explorations”

“与灵能水母对话会令人感到疯狂。小心它的触手，它们可不是用来握手的。我认识的一位外交官尝试通过外交手段与一只塞壬建立‘友好理解’，塞壬同意了，他伸出友好的双臂想要拥抱，塞壬却伸出了它锐利的触手。那可怜的家伙吓坏了，绕着房间跑了好几圈，不停尖叫着：‘太过了！’终于，他的脸爆开了，从里面跳出了一只灵能水母茧蛹。‘理解’达成。这个故事令我意识到了这趟旅行的危险。我可不想要自己的脸爆炸开来。光是说一说就让我觉得，恶心。如果你不希望自己的脸被炸掉，就离灵能水母远一点。”- 玛·瑞格尼布，“RV-3498X：维度探索”

“Life follows a natural course. That’s what I used to believe, until I saw the Psi-Fish Medusa. To gaze upon her is to embrace madness. It flies over the battlefield, like a kite in the air. Its mind radiates callous psionic energy beyond human comprehension. Dizzying insanity swirls in its transparent form. Look away before it senses you and extracts your mind. It glides closer, ignoring every obstacle in its path like a ghost. Oh, that it would pierce me! Why did it leave me alive? Why did it leave me?”—Ensign Janice Kapp, “RV-4583S: Toll of Psi-Fish Diplomacy”

“‘生命遵循自然之道’，在我遇见灵能水母美杜莎之前，我一直是这么认为的。凝视它就是在拥抱疯狂。它在战场上四处飘荡，仿佛空中的风筝一般。它的思想充盈着冷酷的灵能，远超人类的理解。它不断变换的外形能够使人丧失理智。在它感应到你并抽空你的思想之前将视线移开。它会向你靠近，像幽灵一样穿过途中的所有障碍。噢，那时它能够穿透我的！它为什么要放我一条生路？为什么？”- 海军少尉贾尼斯·凯普，“RV-4583S：灵能水母外交费用”
